page.title: 17HEALTH CARE IN LEADENHAM
page.content: The primary health care team compromises a Health Visitor,District Nurse,Midwife and G.P. working together and offering their own expertise.Midwife and Health Visitor see Ante Natal mothers at home and at Clinic. Post natally the mother is visited at home for 28 days,the Health Visitor makes regular visits to assess development until the child is 5.Hearing and sight tests are also made.A well baby clinic is held in Cayhorpe for advice and the sale of baby food.A G.P. also attends.Other services necessitate travel to Grantham or Lincoln.These include Dentists,Opticians and Speech Therapists.A Chiropody van visits the village every 10 weeks for the elderly.Home Helps provide service for the elderly.This is means tested.Meals on Wheels are available if needed.
